question.text: Read the following statements and identify the incorrect one.

options.text: The movements exhibited by macrophages and leucocytes and cytoskeletal elements like microfilaments are examples of the same type of movement.
The activity of muscles located in the reproductive tract is not under the voluntary control of the nervous system.
In the muscle fibers which have less quantity of myoglobin, the number of mitochondria as well as sarcoplasmic reticulum is also less.
The bones of the limbs along with their girdles constitute the appendicular skeleton.

solution.text: Macrophages and leucocytes as well as cytoskeletal elements like microfilaments, both show amoeboid movement. The muscles located in the reproductive tract are visceral muscles. The activity of these muscles is not under the voluntary control of the nervous system. Hence, they are also called involuntary muscles. Muscle fibers having less quantity of myoglobin, the oxygen storing pigment are known as White Fibers, as they have a pale and white appearance. These fibers also have fewer number of mitochondria. But, the number of sarcoplasmic reticulum is high. The appendicular skeleton is constituted by the bones of the limbs along with their girdles.
